bib.title: Detection and Mapping of Cover Crops using Sentinel-1 SAR Remote Sensing data
bib.citation: IEEE Journal of Selected Topics in Applied Earth Observations and Remote Sensing, 2023
bib.author: Sami Najem and Nicolas Baghdadi and Hassan Bazzi and Nathalie Lalande and Laurent Bouchet
bib.journal: IEEE Journal of Selected Topics in Applied Earth Observations and Remote Sensing
bib.abstract: Cover crops are intermediary crops planted in between two main cash crops. They play a role in limiting nitrate leaching into groundwater. Currently, there is no database pertaining to cover crops despite their importance. The development period of cover crops is characterized by a dense cloud cover in Europe, which obstructs land surface monitoring using optical remote sensing. This study proposes a cover crops mapping method based on synthetic aperture radar remote sensing data from the Sentinel-1 (S1) constellation, which is unaffected by weather conditions. Our method is based on the dynamics of the S1 backscattering coefficient at the plot level. Using a decision tree, we mapped cover crops. In the decision tree algorithm, filters were added to eliminate other crops that temporally intersect with the cover crop, namely wheat and rapeseed.
